member.name: T:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration
member.summary: Class to generate XML for importing into FLO.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.FLODateTimeXmlFormat
member.summary: The String format of a DateTime. FLO accepts this format in XML.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.param: If batching is to be used or not.

It UseBatching is true, and BatchLimit is 0, then each batch will be the size of the list of objects in that batch. Different lists will be in different batches. If UseBatching is true, and BatchLimit is not 0, then the batches will be the size of BatchLimit. If UseBatching is false, BatchLimit is ignored, and the single batch returned will have of all the objects in all the lists.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Object)
member.summary: Create an Xml Import string for a single object.
member.param: The object to import. The object must be a List with objects from namespace OPSI.Data.FLO.
member.returns: The Xml String of the object.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Object[])
member.summary: Create an Xml Import string of different object types.
member.param: The objects to import. Each element in the array must be a List with objects from namespace OPSI.Data.FLO.
member.returns: The Xml String for the lists.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.masterDataDocumentRoot
member.summary: Xml root called Import. Holds the last Xml document created by calling CreateXmlImport(). Else null if the method has not been called.

member.summary: The current entry in the batch.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.singleBatchPerList
member.summary: If batching is enabled, but an invalid (less than 0) number is given as a batch limit, then each list of objects is sorted into their own batch.

member.summary: Initialise the import, by naming the root document.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.IncreaseBatchLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the batch limit if not using batching. Set the batch limit if using batching and it has not been set yet.
member.param: The limit to increase the batch by.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.CheckIfBatchFinished
member.summary: Check if the current batch is finished.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.CloseBatch
member.summary: Close the current batch and add the XML string to the list of strings. Restart the XML Document.

member.name: P:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.UseBatching
member.summary: True if batching is to be used.

member.name: P:OPSI.Data.FLO.FLOXmlGeneration.BatchLimit
member.summary: The limit of the number of entries (of any object type) in an import batch. If this is not set, but batching is enabled, then the size of the list of objects to be batched will dicate the size of the batch. For example: If the batch limit is 13 and the number of products to be batched is 2000, then 154 xml strings will be returned.

member.name: T:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration
member.summary: Class to generate XML for importing into PLATO.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.PLATODateTimeXmlFormat
member.summary: The String format of a DateTime. Plato accepts this format in XML.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.param: If batching is to be used or not.

It UseBatching is true, and BatchLimit is 0, then each batch will be the size of the list of objects in that batch. Different lists will be in different batches. If UseBatching is true, and BatchLimit is not 0, then the batches will be the size of BatchLimit. If UseBatching is false, BatchLimit is ignored, and the single batch returned will have of all the objects in all the lists.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Object)
member.summary: Create an Xml Import string for a single object.
member.param: The object to import. The object must be a List with objects from namespace OPSI.Data.PLATO.
member.returns: The Xml String of the object.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Object[])
member.summary: Create an Xml Import string of different object types.
member.param: The objects to import. Each element in the array must be a List with objects from namespace OPSI.Data.PLATO.
member.returns: The Xml String for the lists.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.Product})
member.summary: Create an Xml import string of Products.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.Vehicle},System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.Fleet})
member.summary: Create an Xml import string for vehicles and fleets.
member.returns: The Xml String for vehicles and fleets.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.Job})
member.summary: Create an XML Import of jobs.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateXmlImport(System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.Job},System.Collections.Generic.List{OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.ScheduleJob})
member.summary: Create an XML Import of jobs and scheduled jobs.
member.returns: The Xml String for jobs and scheduled jobs

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CreateDeleteImportXml(OPSI.Data.PLATO.Objects.DeleteImport)
member.summary: Create an XML import to cancel a job.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.masterDataDocumentRoot
member.summary: Xml root called Import. Holds the last Xml document created by calling CreateXmlImport(). Else null if the method has not been called.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.currentEntry
member.summary: The current entry in the batch.

member.name: F:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.singleBatchPerList
member.summary: If batching is enabled, but an invalid (less than 0) number is given as a batch limit, then each list of objects is sorted into their own batch.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.InitialiseImportDocumentTags
member.summary: Initialise the import, by naming the root document.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.IncreaseBatchLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the batch limit if not using batching. Set the batch limit if using batching and it has not been set yet.
member.param: The limit to increase the batch by.

member.name: M:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.CheckIfBatchFinished
member.summary: Check if the current batch is finished.

member.name: P:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.UseBatching
member.summary: True if batching is to be used.

member.name: P:OPSI.Data.PLATO.PLATOXmlGeneration.BatchLimit
member.summary: The limit of the number of entries (of any object type) in an import batch. If this is not set, but batching is enabled, then the size of the list of objects to be batched will dicate the size of the batch. For example: If the batch limit is 13 and the number of products to be batched is 2000, then 154 xml strings will be returned.
